definition: to elope
personal/private/selfish
to go to/to head for/towards
to hurry/to rush/to run quickly/to elope

sentences.english: Our parents didn't want us to marry, so we eloped .
sentences.chinese: 我們的父母親不同意我們結婚，所以我們便私奔。

sentences.english: She is rumoured to have eloped with a priest.
sentences.chinese: 謠傳他和一個牧師私奔了。

sentences.english: Here are instructions on how to announce an elopement.
sentences.chinese: 下面我會就怎樣去宣告私奔列出一些建議。

sentences.english: The parents of the eloped couple tried to annul the marriage.
sentences.chinese: 的父母私奔夫婦試圖取消婚姻。

sentences.english: I am no stranger to the particulars of your youngest sister's infamous elopement.
sentences.chinese: 別以爲我不知道你那個小妹妹不要臉私奔的事。

sentences.english: Spring jiao thought wrong hand to kill people, hence to elopement with mining minister.
sentences.chinese: 春嬌以爲錯手殺了人，遂打算與採臣私奔。

sentences.english: Had they no apprehension of any thing before the elopement took place?
sentences.chinese: 他們倆私奔之前，難道看不出一點形跡可疑的地方嗎？
她的私奔令她父母非常喫驚。

sentences.english: That girl eloped with her lover.
sentences.chinese: 那個姑娘與她的情人私奔了。

sentences.english: The treasure has doped with the manger's daughter.
sentences.chinese: 財務員與經理的女兒私奔了。

sentences.english: The couple had eloped from their hometown.
sentences.chinese: 這對情侶從家鄉私奔出逃。

sentences.english: Romeo decides to elope with Juliette one night.
sentences.chinese: 有天晚上羅米歐決定暸要和茱麗葉私奔。

sentences.english: But, where do lovelorn young couples elope?
sentences.chinese: 但是，害了相思病的年輕情侶們都私奔何方呢？

sentences.english: He also said that they would elope if they had to.
sentences.chinese: 他還說，如果有必要的話，他們甚至會私奔的。

sentences.english: The young couple eloped and got married in Las Vegas.
sentences.chinese: 那對年輕夫婦私奔了並且在維加斯結婚了。
他和他心愛的人私奔了。

definition: to flee to avoid an arranged marriage
to make a pledge to be married, without parents' approval
to go far/to escape to faraway places
lit. to rest and fly together (idiom)/fig. to live in each other's pockets/to be inseparable
to die together in the name of love/to sacrifice oneself for love
to carry on a clandestine love affair
to break a promise of marriage
to leave home (to live somewhere else)
to get married
to roam far and wide (idiom)/to travel the world
lovers' rendezvous/tryst
to remarry (of a woman)
to get married
to love each other
to live together
marriage by capture/bride kidnapping
